"To be honest I was sure we were done for, waking up to an inbound dragon. I don't know how any of those trinkets are supposed to make a dent." 

*Rowan opens the door to see the rain still pouring down.*

"But I don't reckon we'll get choice seats by the hearth if what Bronwynn said is anythin' to go off. I've never seen Leilon so busy."

*Storm saunters into the lobby shortly after.*

"Sul'deni ta'shouva, good to see you both in good health now that we have dried up. Shall we wait for Govath before he head to the Tusk? He should be around shortly, he seemed very eager to get to drinking tonight. I think we all are."
"Best to wait for'im. If he can navigate out of the inn is one thing, but then to find the Tusks in the dark in a rainstorm alone is another thing entirely."

_You finally see Govath make his way around the corner and join everyone in the lobby._

"After wandering through halls for the last several minutes, I believe markers on the walls indicating the direction of the exit would be a pleasant addition to this place."

"You should write that down and add it to the suggestion box. Though there's a certain charm to the place being a maze. Makes the town memorable to passersby forsure."

*Rowan holds the door open for the others.*

"Let's get that fireplace and meal eh, mates?"

The four of you make your way down wet, lantern-lit streets until you find yourselves outside The Orc's Tusks.  You can tell that it's as packed as the last time you came, although the chatter seems quieter than usual.  As you enter through to doors, you see why - the local bard, the Half-Elf Finneus, has the majority of the tavern enchanted by a slow, soothing, almost ethereal melody.  You pause to listen a couple of verses, accompanied by the gentle strumming of his lute.

embeds.title: Finneus
embeds.description:
"♫♫♫

_Come all weary hearts,
In need of respite,
Find rest and relief,
In Selûne's gentle light

Our Lady of Silver,
With beauteous gleam,
By thy grace restore us,
And grant us to dream

Though wander may we,
Through the darkness of Shar,
Keep watch on the sky,
She Who Guides is not far

Our Lady of Silver,
With beauteous gleam,
By thy grace restore us,
And grant us to dream_

♫♫♫"

The song seems to resonate with many of the individuals filling The Tusks, some gently humming along, others discreetly wiping away tears, and a great many seeming to be lost in one memory or another.

embeds.title: Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes a Perception check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (19) + 4 = `23`
*Rowan looks towards the fireplace to see if there's a free table there.*

*Storm whispers as to not ruin the performance.*

"Maybe we came at a bad time. If we're looking for something more lively than perhaps we should go somewhere else..."

As the song winds down, you crane your neck to see past the crowds and toward the hearth.  Much to your chagrin, seated at a large table closest to the inviting warmth of the fire, you spot the Stone-Cold Reavers.  Each is nursing their own mug of ale, a couple have partially finished meals in front of them, but none of that is what draws your eye.

In the centre of the table, on proud display, is a disembodied head, vaguely humanoid in appearance, but with open, yellow, feline eyes and a mane of fur littered with sharp spines.  Its gigantic jaw hangs loose, revealing several rows of sharp teeth.

The tavern bursts into applause as the final note of the song is played.  Finneus stands and takes a bow, and as he rises he catches glimpse of Storm near the entrance.  He gives him a little wink, sits back down upon his stool, and launches into a more upbeat instrumental piece.  Patrons return to conversing, drinking and eating, and as the crowd thins you see the Orc skull upon the wall.  Tonight, the tusks appear to be adorned with an uncomfortable-looking rainbow-coloured wool sweater upon one, and a wet boot upon the other.
"On second thought, this place will do just fine" *he says as he pats his Lute case.*

Ruggo's eyes continue scanning the tavern until they find an empty table suitable for the four of you.  As you make your way over, you catch a glimpse of Lyla sitting with some other women at a table close to the corner where Finneus is performing.  She seems a little flush with the effects of alcohol, applauding and shouting along with the rest of the tavern with a big smile on her face.

The four of you get seated, and before long, Mara appears beside your table to take your order.
"Sul'deni Mara, it is good to see you again. I will take whatever special is on for tonight. Tell me, is there an interesting story behind the items that now hang on the tusks?"

embeds.title: Mara
embeds.description: "One wolf steak and clam soup for the Tabaxi.  Oh, heh, not really - it's been a gag ever since I opened this place for the clowns around here to hang whatever refuse suits their fancy upon the Orc's tusks.   Lends the place a bit a' charm so I let 'em have their fun.  Whatever's left come the morning goes into the waste heap - to be replaced with new _hilarious_ items the next evening."
"Two specials for me, Mara. And five ales on my tab for my mates here."

embeds.title: Mara
embeds.description: "You got it - anyone else?"
"I'll take a special as well, starving tonight."
"One of the specials would do me well.  And one of whatever hot drink you have ready."

embeds.title: Mara
embeds.description: "In addition to the ale, or instead of it?"
"Yeh don't need to worry about us not finishin' the ale, sugar." *Rowan gives her a wink and smile.*

embeds.title: Mara
embeds.description: "Heh, I suppose I don't.  I'll be back shortly with your orders.  So long as Boy hasn't fed all the clams to the stray cats again."
Mara heads off toward the kitchen, leaving the four of you around the table.

_Turning to the group,_ "Before we finally relax and just enjoy the rest of the evening, we should probably decide on the plan for tomorrow, specifically what items we're going to give to the Lance's. "

"Mmm wolf steak...clam soup...delicious. Oh right, tomorrow. Well maybe we present all four of them to the Lances and see which ones they find most useful for the cause. But nothing in the contract states we *must* give them what we have obtained. Govath also had the great idea of trying to contract Fakore into building the Lances a ballista."

"We all hold one of four items. I will present my hat to them tomorrow. If they wish to pay for it then this one will part with it for the cause though it will sadden me to part with it. I've grown fond of it these few days. So perhaps we should leave the decision to each own."

*Storm eyeballs Finneus as he begins to unbuckle his Lute case and retrieve it.*

"It does look like the Reavers have been busy. Do you think they found that beast at the dwarven dig site or on the way to that old widow..."

"That sounds like a plan to me. And perhaps on top of everything, the actual location of Gnomengarde would be worth something as well, considering part of the contract was locating it in the first place. "

"I had a word with Facktoré as we were leaving Gnomengarde.  The ballista will be ready in about a weeks time.  Figured I would tell the lances that it was being built and they would simply pick it up.  Plus the 50 gold for us in acquiring them an automated ballista."

"That's great, I did not think it would be ready so soon. Well the Lances should definitely be impressed. Seige weapons from Gnomengarde. Information of the dragons whereabouts and some magic items. If that's not considered a successful job...well...let the Dragon take this place."
"And I plan to not mention my item to them.  In a pinch it will serve me better than the gold.  However I am near broke so a new job soon would be welcome."

"A ballista is impressive enough for the job I reckon. I also find these gifts we were given prob'ly are more use in everyday adventuring than to take down that juggernaut we nearly fed this morning." 

*Rowan leans in towards them and in a quieter voice,* "If you want gold for em, I also reckon they're worth even more than the Lances'll give us. Mayhaps even Wynn would offer more."

"Well then let's offer then the ballista and the Dragon information tomorrow and see if that satisfies their contract. Now...if you will excuse me, this one has an appetite to work up and a half-elf to outshine."
*Storm begins to test a few chords and becomes lost in thought as he conjures a new tune.*

*Storm stands up after a short moment. Adjusting his cloak and hat, he begins to stroll slowly through the crowd, trying to draw the eyes of the patrons towards this exuberant looking Tabaxi. But as he does, he begins to play a slow and sad melody. The introduction continues for a few phrases as Storm saunters between the tables. And with one quick smirk towards Finneus, Storm begins to sing.*

"♫♫♫
This is a tale of a legend long lost.
Of hearts brought together, and destinies crossed.
Of true love that bound and the price that it cost.
It all began here, one deep Leilon frost.

A boy all alone, an orphan like some.
The cold bitter air caused him to go numb.
He stared at the stars, sitting next to his mum,
Her gravesite unmarked in the dirt ridden slums.    

Years they did pass, the boy all alone.
No future was all that this poor boy had known.
So he grabbed his old sword to set out on his own.
And followed wherever the cold wind had blown.

That clear and dark night, so quiet and still.
The boy stared at stars atop of a hill.
And that is just when the boy did discover,
His fate had entwined as the Leilon lover.

A flash, a roar and streak of bright light.
Crashing beyond the boys' blinded sight.
He grabbed his old sword and raced through the night.
To find a lone girl, wrapped in all bright white.

The girl had fallen from the starry night sky.
She saw the boy come and backed up with a cry.
He reached out his hand, to help her he'd try.
She grabbed it and laughed, and they began to fly. 

They soared through the air over treetops and stone.
They dipped into valleys and forests unknown.
Their destinies merging, their hearts being sewn.
They now had each other, no longer alone.

The season did pass and the warm summer came.
But their love did not die, it continued the same.
They laid on the grass and the boy played a game.
He wanted to give his dear lover a name.

The girl had come to Leilon as a star. 
She explained to the boy that she was from afar.
They did not have names, that was just who they are.
And the ones he did choose just sounded bizarre.
♫♫♫"

"♫♫♫ 
But that summer night the boy he did learn.
His lover, the girl for something did yearn.
She turned and said something that made his heart burn.
For she was a star and she had to return.

The season did pass, and again came the cold.
The girl was sick, in his arms he did hold.
Her light it was dying, no longer as bold.
The boy was distraught but recalled what was told.

He carried her back to the place she was found.
The night was so quiet as he knelt on the ground.
She reached up and touched him and made a soft sound.
*I love you* she said, and their fate was now bound.

Light from above shot down like a beam.
Engulfing his lover, his starry-like dream.
She soared to the cosmos, he wanted to scream.
But instead he just sat there and let cold tears stream.

Alone again, such a familiar tune.
His bright shining star, was taken way too soon.
He sat in the cold and looked up at the moon.
And whispered *My love, your name is Selûne*.

That clear and dark night, so quiet and still.
The man watched the moon atop of the hill.
His body remained and the frost it did cover,
The legend of Selûne and her star-stuck lover.
♫♫♫"

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes a Performance check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (12) + 5 = `17`
*Storm had heard the tail-end of Finneus' song about Selûne and saw all the patrons taking it in. He puts on his best performance and tries to tear jerk every patron in the Tusk with his own rendition of Selûne.*

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes a Performance check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (10) + 5 = `15`
*And just for good measure, Storm seeks the guidance of the powers above to ensure he outshines Finneus. (Meta: Storm uses DM Inspiration)*

Much of the tavern takes great interest in your performance, turning their attention to you as you stroll about, playing your lute.  Even Finneus respectfully stops playing, resting his lute upon his knee and listening to your performance.  You recognize the familiar faces of a handful of patrons which had enjoyed your performances the last time you were here, eager to see what you have in store for them tonight.

Your performance doesn't elicit _quite_ the reaction you had hoped for, but it does seem well-enjoyed.  One silver piece and thirteen copper pieces are deposited in your lute case at the conclusion as you take your bow to a decent round of applause.

Meanwhile, during your performance, the rest of the party notices as Syleen, Brakkis and Jabarl, three of the Stone-Cold Reavers, stand up from their table by the hearth and approach yours.  The remaining Reavers, who you recall are named Dobin and Runa, stay seated at their table.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "Well whaddya know, Brakkis - the sprouts made it back in one piece after all!"

embeds.title: Brakkis Elspaar
embeds.description: "Hah!  I guess that means the next round's on you, Jabarl!"

embeds.title: Jabarl the Orc-Biter
embeds.description: "Plenty of time for them to become Dragon fodder yet."

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "Come now, this is no way to talk in front of our fellow adventurers, is it?  I'm sure they've had a long _long, difficult_ journey back and could do without the teasing of their...peers."

Her voice rides the line between sincerity and sarcasm so finely that it's somehow more infuriating than if she had openly mocked you.  She pulls out Storm's empty chair and sits, leaning forward with crossed arms on the table.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "So tell me, friends - how _did_ your little chat with the Gnomes go?  Come back with anything interesting?"

_Cain tense up at the annoyance of their presence at their table._ "We sure did, but that's between us at the Lances. "

_Turning to Jabarl, he continues,_ "Difficult, no, but we did see the White Dragon first hand. We'll have plenty to report when we talk with Captain Reynolds in the morning."

_Cain then makes an obvious effort to turn in his chair to watch Storm's performance._
_Cain quietly adjusts the mask. It itches sometimes, but something he'll have to get used to._
Syleen starts a little when you begin to speak from the chair to her right, but quickly composes herself.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "_(Muttering) What the..._ - Sorry, I forgot you were sitting there."

"I knew you were a soft hearted fellow Syleen.  Even cared enough to ask about where we went."  _Govath turns his attention from Storms performance and glares at Syleen._  "Now that is a better reputation to have than killing everything you see.  Best be careful, I have heard rumours that many do not like how you handle your misadventures."

"Do not concern yourself over our diplomatic mission to Gnomengarde.  You must have quite the tale having slain the manticore you are so proudly displaying on your table.  Tell us a tale of the infamous Reavers."

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "You hear that boys?  Our reputation precedes us!"
Brakkis and Jabarl let out a low snigger standing behind her.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "You're right, Dwarf, the others are always telling me I'm too soft.  Guess my heart is just too big for my own good.  So let's make this more of a business transaction, shall we?  I'd _love_ to hear about what the Gnomengardians cooked up for Leilon - and in exchange, I would be willing to pass on some useful information we learned while rescuing the old hag from that lovely beastie on our table.  Whaddya say?"

"wgwxemzw jmwl krmmlw trwcx miz sxngw"  _Govath lets out a deep sigh and slowly shakes his head._

"Well a trade in information.  That could be beneficial.  Let us make this official."  _Govath extends his hand halfway across the table to shake hands._

_While doing so he raps his other hand on the table in a very specific pattern._
"drborh?"

messages.content: The pattern of Govath's tapping the table is familiar only to @Osteel

embeds.description: _Cain's has his arm resting on the table as he's watching to Storm's performance though focusing on the conversation at the table. He taps his fingers along with the music._ "cor'p pmsxp pfhj. cor'p rhhc pfhj."
Syleen reaches out and shakes Govath's outstretched hand.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "See, no reason we can't be civil, right?"

_Govath leans back and pulls out his blank coin and begins twirling it between his fingers._ "co rop yommb"

"Civil is by far the best outcome for all parties.  On our mission we found nothing quite as exotic as your beast, but disposed of some rather irritating harpies.  They sung they melodies but fell quickly to their death at the hands of our very own Rown here _slapping Rowan on the back_."

"From there negotiations with the gnomes were successful, they have agreed to aid Leilon in fortifying the city to help defend against the white dragon should Leilon ever catch its attention."

"And what of you, what information do you bring to the table?"

messages.content: @scott make a Deception check

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes a Deception check!

embeds.description: She eyes you suspiciously for a moment, pausing before giving any response.  Finally, she sighs and leans back.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description:
"Well, I suppose the Gnomes' reputation was a bit over-exaggerated.  I confess, I was expecting you'd return with something more than a promise of some regular equipment.  It must have been _disappointing_ to endure such _hardship_ for so little reward.

Well, a deal is a deal, after all..."
"Spending nights under the stars is not what I would consider a hardship."

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes an Insight check!

embeds.description:
As you carefully observe her reaction to gauge whether she believed you gave her all the relevant information, you get a clear sense that she does not trust you, but has not noticed any particular tell that you are lying to her.

Ignoring your comment, you see her reach down into a pouch on her belt, and from it she pulls out a small vial of red liquid, stoppered with a cork.  She sets it down on the table in front of her.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "It seems old lady Gwynn is more than just a midwife - she's also a decent apothecary.  Gave us a few of these for saving her hide, and said she'd be willing to sell us more whenever we'd like.  Fifty gold pieces a pop, but could save your life in a pinch.  After all, we'd hate for Jabarl to win our little wager about your ultimate fates."
Jabarl's mouth cracks open in a menacing grin, revealing several broken teeth.

"Seems like your travels were successful, and who knows maybe you will be lucky and that vial will also fix your teeth.  They really make you look less impressive."  _Govath cracks his own grin, but his beard fully covers his mouth._

Jabarl's grin immediately turns to a scowl, and he takes a step forward toward you, hand going toward his mace - but Syleen raises a single hand and shakes her head, and he steps back, lowering his arm with a low growl.
_Hearing Govath giving it to Jabarl, he laughs a little, but loud enough for the table to hear. He also moves his other hand to his dagger._
"And he still has to pay for your drink, he must be having a rough time."
_Through this whole interaction Rowan has just been leaning back on his chair sideways, one arm around the back so he can see everyone involved._
"Tell me Syleen have you chosen you next job?"

*Storm finishes his new creation of Leilon Lovers and bows to his audience. He gives a respectful but satisfied nod towards the half-elf bard, collects the coin and case and returns to the table.*

*Upon seeing someone in his seat, he places the Lute case you against the table.*

"Ah ta'shouva, you have made a friend tonight! I am Storm of Fire, and who might you be?"
Syleen looks at the Tabaxi, then gives a confused look around the table.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description: "Is uh...is this one alright in the head?"

*At this Rowan leans forward in his chair.* 

"Well yeh see, *this one* has come very far and is adjusting rather well to a new continent and culture if yeh have to know. But seein' as how yer the one..." *and he leans closer and smiles,* "sittin in his seat... I'd say it's yerown head needs examinin."

*Storm shrugs and turns to the group.*

"Do we know...that one? She seems familiar yet unimportant."

*Storm turns to Brakkis with a wide grin outstretched arms.* "Ahh this one I do remember!" *He points to the tusks on the wall with the disheveled sweater and wet boot.* "Your Mother really knows her style, ask her where I can get a sweater like that."

*Storm laughs turning back to Syleen.* "It is custom in Port Nyanzaru to let someone take your seat in a tavern as a show of good hospitality. Please, enjoy the chair, it would honor me."

*Turning to the group he adds;* "I will be back soon."
_Now that the performance is done, Cain turns to face the table, replying to Storm as he heads out,_ "No problem, we'll be here all night!"
Syleen rolls her eyes and stands up from the table, grabbing the potion and putting it back in her pouch.

embeds.title: Syleen Wintermoon
embeds.description:
"I suppose _someone_ didn't get the memo about being _civil_, huh?  Come on boys, time to rest up.

Oh, and Dwarf?  _Qnpw lvxw emvx fxcwzjl krmmlw trwcx sxngwl iclwhe._"
_Govath raises his drink and motioning towards Syleen._  "To future _civil_ meetings."  _Govath then proceeds to down the rest of his ale._
*Storm heads off to the bar after excusing himself.*

Brakkis gives a guttural growl in Storm's direction as the Tabaxi makes his way to the bar, but as Syleen stands and heads toward their table, he follows.  You watch briefly as the three share a brief exchange with the remaining two, who then knock back their drinks and stand as well.  The group leaves the table and heads toward the door, and you lose sight of them among the crowd.
"They are not a half bad bunch."

_As the Reavers are heading past their table on the way out, Rowan stands and removes his hat, holding it to his chest and looks at the floor, his face flushing. Then once gone he sits back down, putting his hat on the corner of his chair._

_Looking into his now empty mug._ 

"I still would not put it past them to kill someone if they have something they want.  We best keep hidden anything we do not want them knowing about."

About this time, Mara appears at the table with all of your food in hand.  She apologizes profusely for the wait, explaining that she had to give Boy a good scolding after he accidentally poured paint into the soup pot.
"Nothin' do, sugar. I reckon yer cookin would still hit the spot with a little paint. So Govath, what was that little exchange with the knocking and other tongue?"
"Ah the dwarvish was a warning about how you make your grave, she was simply returning my earlier comment to her.  The knocking was not more than an open ended question, which no one answered."

_Cain looks at Govath briefly before turning to Rowan,_ 

"What was all that about?"_he gestures with his hands indicating the moment Rowan stood up_
"It's only polite to stand when a lady leaves...."

_Govath lets out the deepest and loudest belly filled laugh you have heard from him yet, lasting a full minute._

_Whipping a tear from the corner of his eye._  "That is one lady who would not appreciate you saying that to her."
"Wait... yeh think.... Syleen? Heh, yeh misunderstand, mate. She ain't no lady..."

"Hmm, if you really want to drive the point home, try adding some flourishes next time.  For example" _Govath nods his head towards to bar._ "just look at our good friend Storm over there trying to charm a drink from the barkeep."
The four of you look over toward your companion, who actually appears to be engaged in conversation with Finneus, the Half-Elf bard who seems to be a regular performer here at The Tusks.
"Wait that is actually the other musician."

messages.content: **Correction:** _Three_ of you

embeds.title: Cain Vance makes an Insight check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (19) + 2 = `21`
*Cain questions whether Rowan is telling the truth, or if he truly is a nice guy stereotype*
*Rowan takes a deep swig of his ale and wiping the foam from his beard,* "Don't know what yeh mean by flourishes..."

_Cain knows that Rowan doesn't get flustered around Syleen, so who?... It then dawns on him that Rowan was standing for the larger female Reaver with the long black hair! He must have a thing for tall ladies or something._
"What was the purpose behind you standing then?"

_Cain recalls the last time him and Rowan had interacted with the Reavers and turns to Govath_

"Ah, he's just being a gentleman I suppose", _as he winks to Rowan. Raising his mug, he continues,_ "I propose a toast, to good adventures!"
_Grabbing one of the extra ales._ "And to explanations behind the wink you just shared."  _Govath raises his fresh mug._
_Rowan stares at Govath for not understanding the situation, but raises his own almost empty mug to the toast._
_Govath raises an eyebrow to Ruggo awaiting an answer._

_Cain shrugs, and having the drink slowly beginning to get to his head, he says_ "Well, I tried steering this awkward conversation, but it looks like we're in it now."

_Joining Govath in staring at Rowan, he continues,_ "Tell us about this crush you have obviously have on , what's her name ... Runa? The big one."

_Spitting his drink out in a spray of mist Govath turns to Ruggo with a wide grin on his face._

"That a boy Ruggo!  She is indeed quite the big one."

"Would you clan approve if you brought her home?"
*Rowan coughs and looks uncomfortable.* "Dunno what yeh mean. But we should stop by the job board tonight and see if there's any left from today."

"Ah.  Yes I see.  My clan would look strangely.  They are very by the books, everything has a set way.  _You follow the same procedure every time when starting a new weapon or piece of armour, so that should carry on to all areas of your life_ they would say.  I was never overly fond of that.  Raised my kids right I did, made sure they knew everyone had a choice and no matter the choice they made, they are still your family or your friend.  That part never changes."
"Uh-huh..."

_Cain leans his face into his hand on the table and slightly groans to himself before speaking up,_ "Anyway, we could look sure, but I was under the impression the Lances posted the contracts at the beginning of each day. And we still need to discuss what is the plan after **this** contract ... are you all planning on staying on with the Lances?"

_Eventually getting the hint Ruggo does not want to talk about it._

"Well I still seek the dragon at some future time, the lances are my best bet at that currently.  I was considering sticking around for another job or two at least.  What about your Cain?"

"Well ... the contract was just to get away from Waterdeep for a little while, I had no intention of actually seeking out this White Dragon. But, Leilon is kind of growing on me, so I'm now I'm thinking more contract work would not only keep me away, but also keep some gold in my pouch since I've lost everything back at home."

_Thinking a bit, he adds,_ "But I guess I should consider if Leilon is worth risking my life over. Both from being eaten by a dragon and by those who are no doubt seeking me out.", _laughing and tapping the mask,_ "Can't believe how lucky I got with this, though."

"What's your plan Rowan?"

*Rowan with a wolf bone in his hands chewing the gristle off his steak.* 

"I've nowhere to be, if Leilon could use somemore help to prep for this dragon I'm game. Worked pretty well with us together so I'd stick around if the lot of you do too."

"And we know that Storm is pretty bent on filling his tome up with bone information, so he no doubt would want to get to this dragon. I suppose that's settled then, we'll take another contract in the morning?"

_Pausing for a second,_ "Though, I eventually have to deal with this face situation. I wonder if there's a mage in that Tower of Thalivar we could quickly speak to before we head out again. There did seem to be some powerful magics emanating from it."
"Hah! Good luck to yeh there mate. The High Tower of Thalivar has been abandoned for ages. Can't even get near it cause of the magics in place."
"Ah, well, nevermind then. Maybe we'll find someone else in our travels, or just ask the White Dragon itself. They're intelligent beings, are they not?"

"Well as I researched dragons for my hammer, I found that white dragons are probably one of the worst to ask something of.  The most likely outcome of that conversation is the questioner being eaten.  I was truly hoping to hear rumour of a silver dragon.  They seemed the most amicable."
_Cain throws his hands up, the drink leading most of the conversation_ "Well, looks like I'm stuck like this forever then!" _, he semi-shouts with  dramatic flair._
"Think of how your trade can flourish if no one is able to describe your appearance."

*Rowan downs the last of his second ale and slams the mug down on the table.* 

"Well mates, first round was on me, yeh reckon a round each will do us for the night? Who's next?"
_Cain raises his hand, trying to get Mara's attention,_ "Sure, I'll get the next one"

*Storm gets up from the bar, bows to Finneus and heads back to the group.*

"Ah, dinner is served. The appetite is strong and this wolf steak looks delicious. How are things here, anything problems with our Reaver friends?"
"Nothin' doin, mate. Cain is gettin the next round."

*Storm begins to wolf down the...wolf...steak.*

"Ah that is good to hear, though this one does enjoy poking fun at the dumb orc of theirs. It's just so easy. That Finneus fellow is a kind half-elf. He is from the Neverwinter wood. It seems like everyone I have met is from or near some sort of forest..."

"We spoke about our professions. He told me a little about the history of the High Tower of Thalivar. It seems like no one has been able to enter it for as long as history has known it. The lore suggests its been standing since before the fall of this lands previous empire which from my vague knowledge of the Sword Coast...is a very long time."
*Storm looks through the tavern window to see if it's still raining outside.*
As you peer outside, you see that the rain is beginning to lighten up - only a soft drizzle remains where once was a downpour.

"It seems like the rain is lightening up a bit though tomorrow is another day. If you all don't drink too much tonight, it might be a nice night for a stroll through town. I've heard there are some nice areas around town at night. Anyone interested?"
"If the rain continues to lighten up I could be persuaded to go for a walk.  But if it is still raining I think I will enjoy being dry, for the first time in a while it seems."

"I quite enjoy the rain. The tree canopy is so dense in the High Forest it's rare to get the drops hittin' the floor. But the sound of it.... Thunderous. When I came to the coast the sound of the ocean reminded me of home in a storm. And the trees release a scent after a rain. I'll join for a walk."
"That is great, keep the adventure going! Let's head out after the next round before it gets too late. Cain will you join us as well?"

"Sure, if we're going to risk our necks to protect this place, we should at least get familiar with everything about it."

_Turning to Govath,_ "C'mon Govath, it's hardly a mist out there. The breeze is always the best after a rainfall."
"Put a couple hundred years on your bones and you will find a warm fire is the best after a rainfall.  I will join though, need to make sure none of you pick a fight without me there."
*Storm finishes his up his dinner and drink, listening to Finneus perform. He is ready to head out whenever the rest are.*

*Rowan also finishes the last of his meal and pushes the plate away from him.* 

"I wonder if the Lionshead is open..."
_Pushing away his now empty plate._  "At your lead, I am ready whenever."

*Getting up and flagging down Mara to pay his tab, Rowan tips her an extra gold and thanks her for the amazing service once again. Then to his friends as they pay,* "Well, I reckon I'm yer guide tonight, heh."

"Actually there is a place I had in mind when I suggested a walk, it's down by the docks. I've heard that it's a place of mystery, a place that locals think is tied to the legend of the High Tower. It's all just fun folklore and silly tales but I thought it would be fun to check out."
"Though it may be a seedier part of town so just keep on your guard. Not expecting any trouble but if there is I am sure it is nothing we can't handle."
"I have been down there, it is not all bad."
"I left my crossbow in my room but I have a couple...less lethal options should things come to fisticuffs."
"Need a spare dagger?"
*Storm pats his rapier hidden under his cloak. *

*Rowen cleans off the hunting knife he had been using to cut his steak and sheathes it. Then pats a hatchet on his left hip, and a bullwhip on his right.* 

"I 'precciate the offer, but I ain't without accoutrements."

embeds.title: Tonight's Tab (The Orc's Tusks)
embeds.description: The four of you settle up with Mara before leaving.
*Storm pays up, thanks Mara for her continuely wonderful services. He makes a point to stop and say good night to Finneus and Lyla before packing up and heading out into the night air.*
_Rowan also heads out the door into the cool dampness._
_Cain pays his tab and thanks Mara for the food. He then joins his companions outside, welcoming the cool breeze that hits him._
_Thanking her for the meal and paying his tab, Govath tightens his cloak around him and pulls up his hood before stepping out into the night._

*Storm leads everyone down the street in the away from the Sword in the direction of the city port.*

"So there is a place just north of the ports that I have heard about. A place the locals do not like to talk about. a place they wish to keep quiet. Now as silly as this sounds and I'm sure the locals wouldn't agree, but whispers suggest this place has something to do with the High Tower of Thalivar. Apparently no one has ever been inside of it and all sorts of tales exist of what it contains. 

It would be unwise to assume any of these rumors are actually logical. If there was a way into the tower, surely it would have been discovered by now after all these years. I just think it would be fun to go see what the fuss is, get to know the town of Leilon a little more personally as it is my first experience on the Sword Coast.

The place is an alley known as the Manyclaws Alley. It can be a bit shady with thieves and the like so we should be on our guard. But there have been stories of strange noises, or mysterious creatures chasing people. Even of people disappearing completely without a trace."

"As you can tell it's all silly folklore and bed time tales. But I am curious about this part of the cities history and find these things inspiration to my work."

*Storm leads them to the Manyclaws Alley with the directions he had learned.*
"Where did you learn all of this? From your new bard friend?"
"The bard and things people say around me. It's surprising what people will tell you if you show an interest.  It's more surprising the things people will say when they think no one can hear."
"So yeh hit it off with the competition? Always thought two bards in a tavern is the start of a rivalry."

"More than two adventuring groups in a tavern where one group has a burning desire to prove that they're better than the rest and nab for the attention of a smaller group? No, it was just a friendly conversation of work and maybe even some collaboration in the future. Plus, bards are a good source of information."

As you talk, Storm leads you down to the docks, then turns north, heading to the far northwest corner of Leilon.  Continuing down the wet streets, the reflected glow of the various tall lanterns lighting your path creates an otherworldly display which you find mildly disorienting.  As you walk along the water's edge and hear the sound of the violent waves crashing against the distant rocks, you can't help but get the feeling that unseen eyes are watching you all the while.  You do get a glimpse of one or two shadowy figures standing about, often the pulsing glow of a cigar briefly illuminating their rough faces.  Govath recalls this area from a previous detour, but it's almost unrecognizable during the cloudy dark of night.

As you continue north, you gradually get the feeling that you are more and more alone, yet the thought grants you no comfort.  The lanterns thin, and eventually disappear altogether, as you reach an area of town where the houses have broken windows and doors, and no light emanates from within. 
 With no stars or moon piercing the rainy clouds above, Cain and Ruggo are longer able to see ahead of them at all, and Storm and Govath can make out only grey shapes and shadows.  You are all suddenly very aware of the cold ocean breeze caressing your skin, giving rise to goosebumps all along your arms.
"Bloody hell, red where are yeh takin us? I can't see a damned thing!" *Rowan whispers in the direction he thinks the Tabaxi is.*

"This should be the place, did anyone bring a light for the darkness impaired?"

*Storm looks around at the ruined homes around the street.*

"This certainly seems like the place. Old, decrepit and spooky enough for a horror story. Every town and city has their scary folk tale and we, good friends, are standing in it. Every city or town has that one distinct landmark that people think about or see when they are here, you know...the tourist trap. Leilon has its Tower of Thalivar. But deeper down, there's also the hidden gems that only locals know about and that is much more exciting."

*Storm peers into a broken window.*

"And now we keep an eye and ear out and discover what gems are hidden in these tales."
*Storm grabs a broken piece of wood debris off a partially boarded up window and breaks it down into a rough length of a torch. He then taps it on his hat a few times.*

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes an Arcana check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (12) + 2 = `14`
*Storm attempts to cast Light on the stick using his hat.*
"Ah, there we go. Now let's see what these shadows hide."

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes a Perception check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (12) + 3 = `15`
*What DO these shadows hide...particularly in the houses.*
"I'm glad you can do that, I left my pack at the inn. Had a torch but this does just as well I reckon."
"As long as the Lances don't want this hat..."

"Not a chance, we're keeping if it can do useful things like create light."

"This place is spooky ... what **exactly** is it that the locals say about it...?"

*Storm sniffs the air.*

"Strange noises...deranged creatures running through the streets...lost wanderers disappearing into the night."

*He pokes his head through another window.*

"No one really knows much about the wizard Thalivar for the tower is named and no one knows what mysteries the tower holds. Most paint him as a good wizard and his tower holds hidden wealth. But I have heard talk that he was a servant of an more sinister deity and the remnants of his deeds remain in these dark corners of Leilon. That is why the locals link this areas...oddities...to the tower. I for one, am just curious to see what happens. Such is the nature of a Tabaxi."
"So are we breakin' in? Or is the door left unlocked for the curious tourists?"

As the glow from your plank of wood illuminates the interior of one building and then another, you find that they appear to be abandoned houses.  What seems interesting is that the level of decay of the furniture and knick-knacks within seem to vary from house to house, and you get the impression that various people at various times have made attempts to live in this area, only to move on shortly afterward.

A little further along, you come to a larger gap between houses.  Raising your makeshift torch, you peer forward and notice that this gap stretches for some distance - further than your light reaches.  Various half-rotten crates and barrels are haphazardly stacked at random intervals, and you see small alcoves and narrower offshoots created by more buildings further down.  The entire passage is pitch-black and far from inviting.  You're pretty sure you have stumbled upon the famed Manyclaws Alley at last.

*Without taking his eyes off the alley, Storm nudges Cain.*

"Think you should shoot a blast of your wand down there and see what happens? Though it would make a thunderous noise."

_Cain laughs nervously,_ "And probably incinerate anything living there. Though that might not be such a bad thing. "

"So this alley, is it the epicenter of all these rumors?"

"We have come this far, let us simply go for a walk down the alley.  The wand could draw unwanted attention."

_With hand resting on his dagger Govath proceeds down the alley._

"Yeah, the Manyclaw Alley...the source of all these tumors. Maybe just keep that wand at the ready."

*Storm points the light down the alley and follows behind Govath.*

"Somethin' tells me I should've come more prepared..." 

*Rowan unsnaps the holster of his hatchet and follows Storm into the alley.*
"Ah, don't be such a scaredy-cat", _Cain says in a slightly higher, barely noticeable pitch._ "If we run into anything, I'll just scare them right back with the ol' disappearing face act."

You slowly make your way down the dark alley, Govath leading the way and Storm just behind, illuminating your surroundings.  The light catches on overhangs, crates and building edges, causing random shadows which leave your eyes darting every which way, always feeling like there's something just beyond the edge of your vision.

messages.content: Let's get a group Investigation check

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes an Investigation check!
Cain Vance makes an Investigation check!
Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes an Investigation check!
Storm of Fire makes an Investigation check!

embeds.description: As you continue further into Manyclaws Alley, an unpleasant stench begins to fill the air.  The four of you continue looking all around you for anything interesting - until suddenly, Govath trips over something, landing in a puddle with a splash.  The unexpected sound causes all of you to jump, but the sight you see when you whip around to look at your fallen companion is far more unsettling.  There, the Dwarf's legs still resting upon it, is a Human corpse, a horrific expression of terror frozen upon its lifeless face.

*Storm waves the stick of light over to Govath and jumps a little at the sight of the body. He reaches down to help Govath up.*

"Now what happened to this poor, unfortunate soul..."
_After a brief shock at the sight of the body, Cain crouches down before it and says,_ "It doesn't look like he went very peacefully ..."

embeds.title: Cain Vance makes an Investigation check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (8) + 1 = `9`
*Cain looks for any indication of how the person died.*

embeds.title: Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes an Investigation check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (**1**) + 1 = `2`
*With just a grunt Rowan moves closer to the corpse and checks for wounds.*
"Dammit I can't see a bloody thing! This is why I stick to a campfire at night."
*Storm shoves the light at the body.* "Does this light help."

_After straightening his close and brushing the dirt off himself._  "What is this body even doing here, do guards not patrol this area?  Ruggo or Cain can either of you tell how long they have been dead for?"

*Rowan stands back up, his poor night vision hindering any chance he hoped to help Cain. He shakes his head,*

"My eyesight is terrible at night, I reckon I should get my eyes checked."
"Govath, shall we have a look?" *Storm laughs.*

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes an Investigation check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (**20**) - 1 = `19`
*Sure make the dwarf who just wanted to have a nice drink by the fire investigate the dead body.  Last time I go walking down a dark alley at night.*
*Storm helps by pointing the light just right.*
"Ah I see it!"  _Govath picks up his dagger._  "So what are we to do about the body?"

"It looks...horrified. Here, hold this."

*Storm passes the light stick to Govath and searches the pockets of the deceased, hunting for clues of who he was.*

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes an Investigation check!

embeds.description: "Yep, that's a body."

As Govath scrambles to his feet, collecting his dropped dagger, the rest of you examine the corpse. What you can plainly see is that it belonged to a Human male, probably early thirties, fairly fit but dressed poorly. The clothes themselves have several tears in them, through which you can see deep chunks of flesh have been torn from the body in several strips.  You find no other interesting features.

"Well this just got more interesting. These don't look like sword wounds, they're too vicious. Not sure if they truly has anything to do with the Tower but it's intriguing nonetheless. What do you make of it friends?"

"Claw marks? A large creature of some kind? But the body hasn't been devoured ... so killed for the sake of killing? We best be on our guard either way. This little exploration trip might turn dangerous soon enough."

_Cain pulls out his weapons  just to be ready._
"I admit this is much more interesting now. Good on ya, Red."

"This confirms the rumor of something lurking in this alley...ironically named Manyclaws Alley. Do you think they named it as such because of the incidents or the incidents are a result of the name. Hmm..."

*Sword draws his rapier and stands up with the light stick.*

"Let us go a little further in and see what other mysteries lay about, while this light lasts."
"Uh, whatdya mean *while this light lasts*? You can cast it again right?"
"The arcane power in the hat has diminished, I do not think it will work again for some time. But the spell should last an hour."

As you turn to continue deeper into the alley, you suddenly hear a faint whispering. You have difficulty determining what direction it's coming from - in fact, it seems to be coming from all around you. And it doesn't appear to be a single voice, but many, chanting the same phrase over and over again in a low whisper. More voices add to the chant every few seconds, overlapping and chaotic, until it echoes off every surface around you.

"_lbr fxnpr bow erra fonj, lbr xrtoxj roxarj. cuqnolox'w bhavrx nw offrowrj. oaj wu tr tonl halnc brx pxoqnav vxutw uapr suxr._"

It is not in any language that the four of you understand, but you make out the same sounds repeating again and again. Your eyes dart around for any sign of life, but you see only the ever-dancing shadows created by Storm's makeshift torch.
"Uhh...vicious beast, check. Spooky whispers, check. Disappearances...let us not check off that rumor. This light does not give us a stealthy advantage on who or whatever is making that chant."

As Storm quietly voices his concern to his companions, it quickly stops being a problem...in a sense. All of the voices stop at once.

And then, Storm's light goes out.

The four of you are plunged into complete darkness. A pause. And then the sound of metal scraping across the ground. Headed in your direction from deeper into the alley.
_Rowan grabs his hatchet from the holster, then casts Detect Magic._
You're not sure in the moment whether this comforts or terrifies you, but you sense no magical presence near you, other than what you expect from the items your companions bear.
"I don't sense anything magical nearby. Hope that means whatever is down there coming for us can be killed."

*Storm scans ahead as best as he can.*

"Well something magical put out this light of mine. Does anyone else have a source otherwise this could get very challenging, very quickly..."
_Govath draws two daggers and peers in the direction the noise is coming from._

_Remembering his travelling pack is in the room,_ "I have a lantern ... but it's back at the Inn. I guess we didn't exactly prepare to do this kind of adventuring tonight. Lets just stick close together and  maybe stick to the sides of the alley. I get the feeling that sound isn't friendly."

_Cain begins to move to the right side of the alley hoping to find an opening that might be able to duck into_

Cain begins feeling around wildly for the walls to your right, and with Storm's help finds a three-foot gap between two buildings that the four of you manage to squeeze into.  Before long, you hear the thud of heavy footsteps accompanying the sound of scraping metal.  After a moment, both sounds stop, and you hear a single voice whisper down the alley.

"_iuhx ycrwb arrj aul er er soxxrj lbnw anvbl, yux lbr sonjra uy fona nw wolnwynrj.  ehl ny iuhx tnwb nw lu eowz na brx wtrrl ovuai, lbr fonavnqrxw tncc wrxqr._"

messages.content: Meta; who is at the front of the squeeze line, facing the alley we just entered from (aka, last one to squeeze in?)
Meta; as you and Cain found the alley it would be me or Ruggo, and since I was trying to look towards the noise I'm assuming I would be last in.
Meta; Thanks for volunteering, we will remember you.
Meta; anytime volunteer as tribute

embeds.description:
*Storm whispers trying to keep his voice low, unsure if the creature just beyond knows where they are.*

"Govath, what do you see? Is it talking to us? I don't understand what it's saying..."
"And Cain, does this passage lead to another alley, can you see down there? Or are we trapped..."

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes a Perception check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (**20**) + 3 = `23`
*is anything visible where the voice is coming from?*

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes a Perception check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (3) + 3 = `6`
*rubbing his eyes with the back of his hand Govath peers deeper into the darkness.*
_Being the first the gap, Cain feels his way a little further down to get a sense of how far it goes._

Govath risks a little peek around the corner, doing the best he can to make out the grey silhouette of a figure further down the alley.  It appears to be a large humanoid, easily eight feet tall and thick with muscle.  Hanging from one of its hands is what appears to be a whip which splits at the end into several tips, each of which has hooked pieces of metal fixed to the end.  You're pretty sure you know how the corpse in the alley acquired his unusual wounds.

Cain begins feeling around deeper into the crevasse you find yourselves in, until his hands come against a tall pile of weathered wooden crates which block further progression about twenty-five feet from the main alley.
_Cain quietly returns to the others and whispers,_ "It's a dead end down there, we're cornered if anything shows up."
_Whispering back to the group in answer._ "Well whatever the creature is, it has a nasty looking whip that is easily what caused our dear friend to perish.  Do we fight or flee?"
"Fight in total darkness? I can't see a thing mate, I'm a little outta my element on this one."
"Let us wait then for the creature to leave and we make a run for it then."  _Govath looks back out to keep an eye on whatever it is._

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes a Stealth check!
embeds.description:
1d20 (7) + 7 = `14`
*quietly as possible he leans his head out.*

embeds.title: Govath Forgearm makes a Perception check!

embeds.description: The creature pauses a moment, then takes a few heavy steps down the alley in your direction.  As it gets closer, you get a better look.  Its skin is pale, and it seems to be wearing the tattered remains of some kind of sleeveless robe over its muscular frame.  You notice that both its shoulders seem striped with bad wounds - in fact, almost every area of skin you can make out seems to be marred in one way or another.  But none so horrifyingly as the face, the skin of which seems pulled unevenly tight over the skull by randomly-arranged hooks, resulting in a twisted, unnatural expression.  You see no eyes peering out from the shadowy sockets, yet the creature's head occasionally scans back and forth as it makes its way toward you.

messages.content: It's unclear to you whether it knows you are still there or not, but your window to take action is swiftly narrowing.  You can stay hidden and pray the creature leaves, you can stand and fight, or you can make a run for it while there's still time.

embeds.description: _Whispering to the group._  "This is our chance if we are to make a run for it.  Get yourselves ready.  We go on three."

"I will distract the creature."  _Getting a handful of ball ratings out of his belt pouch and taking a deep breath._  

"Three." _Govath burst out of the alley yelling and throwing the ballbearings at the creature, only to turn tail and run as fast as he can in the direction they came from._

messages.content: *ball bearings

embeds.description: _Rowan follows as fast as his feet will take him._
*As Ruggo dashes out, Storm follows close behind and begins an incantation. As he exits the alley, he looks towards the creature and casts Charm Person.*

embeds.title: Storm of Fire casts Charm Person!

fields.name: Effect
fields.value:
It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance.

When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

embeds.description: _Feeling safe being the furthest into the gap, he suddenly felt the most exposed as his companions bolt from their hiding spot one by one. Cain follows closely behind._

The four of you bolt from your hiding place, sprinting toward the distant light of the lanterns to the south.  As you emerge, the creature stops in its tracks, slowly tilting its head to one side about thirty feet from you.  As Storm runs out, he casts _Charm Person_, which he feels fizzle out immediately with no effect.  As Cain scrambles out, bring up the rear, he turns to see that the creature seems to not be giving pursuit.  It just stares as you make your escape, and you hear a faint whisper echo behind you as you reach the alley's exit.

"_iuh arrj aul yrox lbr tbnf'w poxrww.  xrlhxa tbra iuh oxr xroji lu rsexopr lbr sonjra'w wtrrl ovuai._"

The four of you continue at your pace until you are well within the relative comfort of the lanterns' light, only then stopping to catch your breath.  You turn around to peer into Manyclaws Alley once more, but you see only impenetrable darkness, and hear no further sound emanating from within.
_Rowan has turned back into his firbolg form, unable to hold his disguise through the exertion._
_Huffing and puffing as Govath tries to catch is breath._  "Do any of you also find that strange?  I mean it did not make chase, could it be a patrol?"
*Rowan also trying to catch his breath says in between gasps,* "I find it strange... that I did not detect... any magical presence, yet... Storm's light was snuffed...by no physical means...phew."
*Storm is unsurprised that the spell winked out though tested it to be sure. Hearing the whispering more clearly during the escape, he wonders if he knows the language despite not understanding it.*

embeds.title: Storm of Fire makes an Intelligence check!

embeds.description: Unfortunately, the sounds do not remind you of any language which you have heard spoken by any of the many travellers you have guided through the Jungles of Chult.

*Catching up to the group, Storm adds to Rowan's point while panting.*

"This one...tried...to cast another...spell on it. But it...didn't...even...manifest."

*Taking a deep breath, he slows his breathing.*

"A field of anti-magic of sorts. Maybe the creature cannot leave that field, which is why it didn't pursue us. And we walked right into it.

Also, that language we heard. Was the voice coming from the beast or another source? The language is unfamiliar to me."

*Rowan shakes his head and shrugs.* 

"Sounded like the voice was coming from everywhere."

"Well, that thing looked quite undead. Dark magic is happening here. How or if it relates to the High Tower of Thalivar, I do not know. But I'll keep my ears open for more rumors. We have stumbled on something unnatural and now my curiosity must be satisfied. A trait of the Tabaxi." *Storm chuckles.*

"Turned out to be more thrilling of a walk than I had expected.  We will definitely need to learn more of this place.  In the mean time what say that we return to our inn and get some much needed sleep."

"We definitely do", _Cain agrees with Govath,_ "But what I'm wondering is how such a place could exist untouched. Doesn't Leilon have a patrol or anything? We should ask the Lances what the deal with that place is ..."

"Also, we shouldn't be needlessly risking our lives going back there if we have no purpose. That was a little too close."
"I reckon the Lances know all about this alley, and are scared stiff. We'll ask about it in the mornin' for sure. But Govath is right, I need a bed somethin' fierce."

"The locals avoid this area all together, especially the Manyclaws Alley. Most of this district appears abandoned, and contain only thieves and brigands. We could report our findings to the Lances tomorrow with our contract. Let's get out of here while we still can in any case. Unfortunately I cannot create another light so keep on guard until we're back on the main road."

*Storm leads the way back towards the docks and into Leilon proper.*

*Rowan sidles up beside Storm.* 

"Well that was quite an adventure, eh Red? Not like you knew before we went traipsing in there unsupplied that it was dangerous." 

Rowan gives him a wink, a grin, and punches his shoulder playfully but with enough force to hurt a bit.

"Next time you have a hankerin' for explorin' I'll be sure to bring the big gun."

*Storm laughs it off.*

"Well...this one did tell you about the voices. Oh and the strange monsters. Oh and the disappearances. It's fair to say that the danger was pretty much laid out for us. But whether you believed the stories or not was up to you. To be honest, I would have gone alone if no one else was interested.

...and this one plans on coming back."
"Though with magic being dispelled in that alley...it will create an interesting adventure."
"Perhaps this alley could be our next contract with the lances.  No travelling required, we have some preliminary information on it.  Could be not a half bad deal."

"Let's take it to them tomorrow. But let's try to be mindful of who hears about this. The last thing we need is the Reavers showing up, trying to take something we discovered just to spite us."

*Storm continues walking into the night, satisfied with the nights adventure.*

You make your way back down the dark streets toward The Sword of Leilon.  Even most of the shady figures you spotted on your way to Manyclaws Alley seem to have retired for the night, and your walk is uninterrupted.

As you push open the door and cram into the now-familiar lobby, you notice a piece of parchment laid out upon the desk.  It reads, in Common, "New patrons, ring bell for service".  Nobody is currently behind the desk, and you get the feeling that you are expected to find your own way to your rooms this late at night.

messages.content: Now let's have some fun - I need a Survival check from each of you, unless you choose to ring the bell anyway

embeds.title: Cain Vance makes a Survival check!
Storm of Fire makes a Survival check!
Rowan "Ruggo" Rhododendron makes a Survival check!
Govath Forgearm makes a Survival check!

embeds.description:
Ruggo gives a tip of his hat to the rest of you, then confidently struts down the right hallway and disappears out of sight.  You remaining three give each other a look, bid each other goodnight, and set off in the directions you _think_ are correct.

By an hour later, you've passed each other with an embarrassed wave several times, attempted to stick your keys in doors where they did not fit, and heard some noises you wish you hadn't - but eventually, you find the correct rooms and settle in for a much-needed sleep.

messages.content: Congratulations - you all have achieved **Level 3**
